bin/bbssp.c

00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Bottleneck Biconnected Spanning Subgraph solver.
00003  *
00004  * Solves the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem (BBSSP) problem
00005  * on the given input files.
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup bin
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "arrow.h"
00011 #include <getopt.h>
00012 
00013 /**
00014  *  @brief  Prints help/usage message.
00015  */
00016 void 
00017 print_help();
00018 
00019 /**
00020  *  @brief  Prints version message.
00021  */
00022 void 
00023 print_version();
00024 
00025 /**
00026  *  @brief  Prints usage message.
00027  */
00028 void 
00029 print_usage();
00030 
00031 /**
00032  *  @brief  Reads program arguments.
00033  */
00034 void 
00035 read_args(int argc, char *argv[]);
00036 
00037 /**
00038  *  @brief  Prints output in XML format.
00039  */
00040 void 
00041 print_xml_output(int obj_value, double total_time, int argc, char *argv[]);
00042 
00043 /* Program options */
00044 char *program_name;             /**< Program name */
00045 char *input_file;               /**< Given input TSPLIB file */
00046 int xml_output = ARROW_FALSE;   /**< Output output in XML format (or not) */
00047 
00048 /****************************************************************************
00049  * Function implemenations
00050  ****************************************************************************/
00051 int 
00052 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00053 {   
00054     int stdout_id;
00055     
00056     /* Read program arguments */
00057     program_name = argv[0];
00058     read_args(argc, argv);
00059     
00060     /* Supress output if required */
00061     if(xml_output) 
00062         arrow_util_redirect_stdout_to_file(ARROW_DEV_NULL, &stdout_id);
00063     
00064     /* Try and read the problem file and its info */
00065     arrow_problem problem;
00066     arrow_problem_info info;
00067     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, &problem))
00068     {
00069         arrow_print_error("Could not read input file.\n");
00070     }
00071     if(!arrow_problem_info_get(&problem, &info))
00072     {
00073         arrow_print_error("Could not read problem info.\n");
00074     }
00075     
00076     /* Solve BBSSP */
00077     arrow_bbssp_result result;
00078     if(!arrow_bbssp_solve(&problem, &info, &result))
00079     {
00080         arrow_print_error("Could not solve BBSSP on file.\n");
00081     }
00082     printf("\nBBSSP Solution: %d\n", result.obj_value);
00083     printf("Total Time: %5.2f\n", result.total_time);
00084     
00085     /* Output result */
00086     if(xml_output)
00087     {
00088         arrow_util_restore_stdout(stdout_id);
00089         print_xml_output(result.obj_value, result.total_time, argc, argv);
00090     }
00091     
00092     /* Free up the structure */
00093     arrow_problem_destruct(&problem);
00094     arrow_problem_info_destruct(&info);
00095     
00096     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00097 }
00098 
00099 void 
00100 print_help()
00101 {
00102     print_usage(program_name);
00103     printf("\n");
00104     printf("Runs the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem on\n");
00105     printf("the given TSPLIB file.\n");
00106     printf("\n");
00107     printf("Options:\n");
00108     printf("  -h, --help                print this help, then exit\n");
00109     printf("  -V, --version             print version number, then exit\n");
00110     printf("  -x, --xml                 outputs result in xml format\n");
00111     printf("\n");
00112     printf("Report bugs to <johnlr@gmail.com>.\n");
00113 }
00114

00120     printf("    John LaRusic, Eric Aubanel, and Abraham Punnen.\n");

00122     printf("This is free software.  You may redistribute copies of it\n");
00123     printf("under the terms of the GNU General Public License \n");
00124     printf("    <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>.\n");
00125     printf("There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.\n");
00126     printf("\n");
00127     printf("Written by John LaRusic.\n");
00128 }
00129 
00130 void 
00131 print_usage()
00132 {
00133     printf("Usage: %s [options] tsplib_file\n", program_name);
00134 }
00135 
00136 void 
00137 read_args(int argc, char *argv[])
00138 {
00139     int opt_idx;
00140     char opt;
00141     char *short_options = "hVx";
00142     struct option long_options[] =
00143     {
00144         {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00145         {"version", no_argument, 0, 'V'},
00146         {"xml", no_argument, 0, 'x'}
00147     };
00148 
00149     while(1)
00150     {
00151         opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options, long_options, &opt_idx);
00152         if(opt == -1) break;
00153         
00154         switch (opt)
00155         {
00156             case 'h':
00157                 print_help(argv[0]);
00158                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00159                 break;
00160             case 'V':
00161                 print_version(argv[0]);
00162                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00163                 break;
00164             case 'x':
00165                 xml_output = ARROW_TRUE;
00166                 break;
00167             default:
00168                 printf("Option: %c\n", opt);
00169                 print_usage(argv[0]);
00170                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00171         }
00172     }
00173     
00174     /* Read the file name to process */
00175     if(optind == argc)
00176     {
00177         arrow_print_error("No problem files specified.\n");
00178         print_usage(argv[0]);
00179         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00180     }
00181     else if(optind < argc - 1)
00182     {
00183         arrow_print_error("Multiple input files specified.\n");
00184         print_usage(argv[0]);
00185         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00186     }
00187     input_file = argv[optind];    
00188 }
00189 
00190 void 
00191 print_xml_output(int obj_value, double total_time, int argc, char *argv[])
00192 {
00193     printf("<arrow_bbssp problem_file=\"%s\" command_args=\"", input_file);
00194     int i;
00195     for(i = 0; i < argc; i++)
00196     {
00197         if(i > 0) printf(" ");
00198         printf("%s", argv[i]);
00199     }
00200     printf("\">\n");
00201     printf("    <objective_value>%d</objective_value>\n", obj_value);
00202     printf("    <total_time>%5.2f</total_time>\n", total_time);
00203     printf("</<arrow_bbssp>\n");
00204 }
